intro: Eriocephalus pedicellaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriocephalus, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, narrow leaves are covered in fine, soft hairs, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
